comment: Can't get it to work.

title: Need better instructions for OsmAnd
comment: I would love to find clearer instructions for configuring brouter on the Galaxy S5, with OsmAnd, with the sd card for the data,  and lollipop.  I'm sorry,  I'm patient enough,  but the instructions are not in great English and are pretty confusing.

title: Hi
comment: Hey I like it this app.  ©

This is an awesome app.  I used it for a 1600 mile tour of the UK using the recumbent profile (vm-forum-liegerad-schnell.brf), this consistently took me on quiet roads and avoided the worst hills.  As others have said it takes a bit of work to understand and set it up to use, but to me it is well worth investing the time.  I used it with OSMAND, with a headphone in one ear so I could head the announcements over any traffic, and the 'Turn Screen On' function so the screen was only lit when approaching a junction saving precious battery.

title: Navigation
comment: Find my way home
It's don't have any options how to use it
I dont really know how to use these i think it is much better if you have to put instructions first before downloading the grid so that the user will know what to do.. please explain... thank you

title: THE missing link in bicycle navigation
comment: I cannot express how wonderful this software is! On a tour across the continent it guided me to big and small places, sometimes along such small roads that locals thought it was a dead end (it wasn't). My life has truly been enriched by brouter, THANK YOU!

title: Incredibly powerful
comment: The UI needs some serious polishing, but the flexibility of the configuration language is unmatched.

title: Amazing
comment: Saved us many times on our 5000km across Europe.
Ok
5* if UI was nicer. Just needs to dump the Android 2.0 style. It is not that hard, other than that this app is solid 4*, adds offline route calculation that is extremely useful!
Don't understand why a 3.9 rating. Definitely deserves more. Maybe a demo video would help

title: Good

title: Good but interface could be greatly improved
comment: Button to download data in bottom right corner is very small and easily missed on high res devices. In addition it can't download in the background - hence if you switch apps or switch the screen off it seems to cancel the download and you need to start again. Once I'd figured it out - which took a while - it's great.

title: Great, but not for everyone
comment: You need patience and a bit of intelligence, but once you get this working it's insanely good.  It's the bike GPS that routes like a local.   Think 'cut through the supermarket car park to the laneway, and on to the bike path...'
Very best
great job of making offline routing easy! make a donate version, please!

title: Awesome
comment: I use it with Locus (Change the routing service in settings). Its been very fast and useful.

title: Great App
comment: Fast and Flawless. U can download any area for offline use. Im using it with oruxmaps.

title: very user unfriendly
comment: cannot even understand what it's for nor how it works even after playing with it for some time!!!!  I have Locus and use it all the time. By the way, "Biroute" (pronounced beeroute) in French means penis and "Brouter" (pronounced "brootai") means to graze and "Birouter" (pronounced "beeroutai") means to urinate or to steal.  I would suggest a name change! The online version is very interesting so I wanted it on my android.  I installed it with google play and  ran the download manager and downloaded my region.  So far so good.  Then what?  Nothing more to configure in brouter andn nothing appears in Locus regarding brouter.  Unlike with Osmand, how does one "switch the navigation service" in Locus?  Concerning the French, I was just trying to help the developper!

was your playing along the french pronouncations or did you try to download routing-data files, switch the navigation service in Locus to BRouter and calculate offline routes? What problems did you encounter?

title: Fantastisch.
comment: Openandromaps * ( BRouter + Locus ) = lots and lots of joy. Thanks a lot!
